title: Huge export potential for alcoholic beverages; may reach $1 bn by 2030: APEDA Chairman
desc: Indian alcoholic beverage exports are poised for significant growth, potentially reaching USD 1 billion by 2030, driven by diverse offerings like gin, beer, wine, and rum. Government officials urge the industry to explore global markets and enhance product quality to boost exports. Focus on value-added products and reducing agricultural wastage is crucial for maximizing benefits to farmers and producers.

title: Agrinnovate India declares maiden dividend of Rs 1.42 crore
desc: Agrinnovate India Limited (AGIN), the commercial wing of ICAR, has announced its inaugural dividend of Rs 1.42 crore for fiscal year 2023-24, since its establishment in 2011. This milestone was marked by a formal presentation to Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan, highlighting AGIN's role in bridging agricultural research with practical application.

title: $50 million prize funded by Musk foundation goes to Indian carbon-capture company
desc: Mati Carbon, an Indian company, has won a $50 million XPRIZE for its innovative method of spreading crushed rock on fields to capture atmospheric carbon dioxide. This approach, known as enhanced rock weathering, accelerates natural processes while also benefiting farmers.

title: Biologicals "at forefront" of agricultural shift, says Syngenta India chief
desc: Syngenta India's head Susheel Kumar highlighted the transformative potential of biologicals in ensuring food security at the BioAg World Congress. He emphasised the necessity of partnerships to expedite solutions for farmers facing challenges like resistance and climate change. Kumar noted that biologicals, including biostimulants and biocontrols, offer farmers more sustainable options.

title: How ‘hypnotising seers’ from a Uttarakhand village used magnets to cheat people in Gurgaon
desc: Thandanala, a village in Uttarakhand, became infamous for its con artists. These fraudsters travelled to different states and cheated people. They pretended to find hidden treasures. They used bowls and magnets to hypnotise victims. Police arrested two men from the village for theft in Gurugram. Authorities are investigating similar offences in other states like Maharashtra, Gujarat, Rajasthan and UP.

title: In troubled waters: Trump’s tariffs threaten India’s shrimp lifeline
desc: Trump’s tariffs to hit Indian shrimp processors and farmers hard, given that the US accounts for 41% of India’s shrimp exports.

title: Tobacco licence validity extended
desc: The government has extended the validity of registration certificates or licenses for tobacco farmers from one year to three years. This change aims to assist approximately 83,500 farmers across Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Telangana, and Odisha in managing their license renewals for around 91,000 barns.

title: Widow of 26/11 martyr policeman appointed as Deputy SP on probation
desc: The Maharashtra government appointed Kalpana Pawar, widow of 26/11 martyr Ambadas Pawar, as a probationary Deputy Superintendent of Police. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis issued the direct appointment orders. Kalpana Pawar expressed her gratitude, emphasizing her opportunity to serve the people like her husband, who sacrificed his life during the Mumbai terror attacks at CSMT.

title: Maharashtra: Marathwada records 269 farmer suicides in Jan-March 2025, up by 65 in same period last year
desc: Marathwada region witnessed a surge in farmer suicides, reaching 269 between January and March 2025, a significant increase from 204 in the previous year. Beed district recorded the highest rise. Shetkari Sanghatana criticized the government for unfulfilled loan waiver promises, citing reduced crop yields, increased input costs, and farmers selling soybean below the MSP as contributing factors.

title: 'They keep meeting over work': NCP (SCP) MP Supriya Sule on Ajit Pawar meeting Sharad Pawar
desc: Amidst political speculation, Supriya Sule clarified that Sharad Pawar's meeting with Ajit Pawar concerned agricultural AI, not political alliances. Sule also urged Maharashtra's CM for an all-party meeting to address rising crime and water issues. Meanwhile, Sanjay Raut discussed potential reunion of estranged cousins Raj and Uddhav Thackeray, emphasizing emotional talks over a formal alliance, prioritizing Maharashtra's interests.

title: Food Fables: How cow dung cooking shaped Indian cuisine
desc: David Chang's culinary exploration in India led him to appreciate the traditional use of cow dung as fuel, influencing the slow and gentle cooking methods. While controversial, cow dung has historical significance as fuel and fertilizer, facing criticism and evolving with changing agricultural practices. Despite declining usage, its impact on Indian cuisine remains undeniable.

title: SKM announces campaign against NDA in Bihar, protests against new labour codes, Vance's visit
desc: Samyukt Kisan Morcha will hold Mahapanchayats in Bihar to campaign against the BJP and NDA in the upcoming elections. They are supporting the general strike called by CTUs against new labour codes and will protest US Vice President JD Vance's visit over tariff issues.

title: Haryana Govt to pay compensation to farmers affected by arson incidents
desc: Haryana's government will compensate farmers for crop and livestock losses due to arson, Chief Minister Saini announced. He also inaugurated a bridge in Panchkula, highlighting the state's rapid development under the current government.

title: Primary focus of Modi govt to transform India into Viksit Bharat by 2047: Nirmala Sitharaman
desc: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized the Modi government's commitment to transforming India into a developed nation by 2047, prioritizing sunrise sectors and fiscal prudence. She highlighted India's success in managing fiscal deficits and the Prime Minister's focus on women, the poor, youth, and farmers.

title: Cloudburst-triggered landslide kills three in J&K's Ramban district
desc: A cloudburst in Ramban, Jammu and Kashmir, triggered a devastating landslide, resulting in three fatalities and the closure of the national highway. The intense weather, characterized by thunderstorms, hailstorms, and flash floods, has inflicted significant damage on orchards, causing substantial losses for farmers. Rescue operations are underway to assist those affected by the disaster.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi vows to continue protests against Waqf law till it is withdrawn
desc: Asaduddin Owaisi has vowed sustained protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, accusing the Centre of targeting Muslim identity. He likened the agitation to the farmers' protests and asserted that demonstrations would continue until the law's withdrawal. Owaisi criticized the government's stance on triple talaq, CAA, and the Uniform Civil Code.

title: BJP govt's two achievements are 'Pakora' and 'Bhagoda': Akhilesh Yadav takes jibe at BJP
desc: Akhilesh Yadav, Samajwadi Party president, strongly criticized the BJP, accusing them of prioritizing insignificant matters and ignoring public concerns. He questioned the Waqf Act's relevance to farmers' needs and alleged BJP's involvement in instigating riots. Yadav also pledged to uphold the Constitution and take action against those who incite violence, following a controversial statement by party MP Ramji Lal Suman.

title: Punjab govt to provide 33% subsidy on BT cotton hybrid seeds
desc: The Punjab government is set to provide a 33% subsidy on BT cotton hybrid seeds recommended by PAU, Ludhiana, allocating ₹20 crore for the initiative. This move aims to alleviate financial strain on cotton farmers, discourage non-recommended hybrids, and expand cotton cultivation to 1.25 lakh hectares, promoting crop diversification and sustainable practices.

title: Kashmir experiences fresh snow and heavy rainfall; Road closures, school suspensions as weather takes a turn
desc: Kashmir experienced varied weather conditions as higher altitudes received fresh snowfall, disrupting transportation on key routes like Gurez-Bandipora Road and Srinagar-Leh National Highway. Lower regions, including Srinagar, were hit by widespread rain, thunderstorms, and hail, causing damage to crops. Authorities have issued weather advisories, cautioning farmers and highlighting the risk of landslides in vulnerable areas until Monday.

title: Farmer fooled by tariff talk? Upstate NY farmer stunned as Trump tariffs hit hard, admits he thought Canada, not U.S. farmers, would foot the bill
desc: Upstate NY farmer Nicholas Gilbert got a shocking $2,200 bill on a feed order from Canada—thanks to Trump’s tariffs. The dairy farmer from Potsdam mistakenly thought Canada would pay the tariff, not realizing American importers bear the cost. With no cheaper supplier nearby and milk prices fixed by a co-op, Gilbert is stuck. As President Trump’s trade war continues, other small businesses along the U.S.-Canada border are also hurting, from manufacturers to ski resorts.

title: India urges global support for small farmers amid climate change, price challenges
desc: India advocated for prioritizing small and marginal farmers in global agricultural strategies at the 15th BRICS Agriculture Ministers meeting. Shivraj Singh Chouhan emphasized the necessity of policy support to empower these farmers against climate change and market volatility. BRICS nations launched a land restoration partnership and committed to a fair, sustainable agri-food system, inviting participation in World Food India 2025.

title: IIT Guwahati, HDFC Parivartan power sustainability push in Northeast India
desc: IIT Guwahati, in collaboration with HDFC Parivartan, is implementing technology-driven interventions in Assam and Meghalaya to enhance food and energy security. The project focuses on biomass pellet production, agrivoltaics farming, tea processing, and freeze-drying facilities. These initiatives aim to empower farmers, promote sustainable agribusiness models, and boost the rural economy.

title: SOPA urges delay on soybean stock sale to protect prices ahead of kharif sowing
desc: The Soybean Processors Association of India (SOPA) has urged the Union Agriculture Ministry to further delay the sale of soybean stocks by NAFED and NCCF until after the kharif sowing season concludes. SOPA fears that releasing the stock prematurely will depress prices, harming farmers and causing losses for the government, reversing the positive price movement seen after the initial postponement.

title: Delhi govt approves 3-month extension of EV policy, continues power subsidy
desc: The Delhi government has extended its Electric Vehicle (EV) policy for three months and will continue providing power subsidies to domestic consumers, farmers, lawyers, and 1984 riot victims. Transport Minister Pankaj Singh clarified that there will be no ban on autos or any other vehicle category.

title: Andhra Pradesh mulls pooling 30,000 more acres for Amaravati; no decision yet: Minister
desc: The Andhra Pradesh government is contemplating acquiring 30,000 acres around Amaravati via land pooling to develop a mega city, complete with an international airport. While no final decision has been made, Chief Minister Naidu is eager to integrate nearby areas. Reconstruction in Amaravati has commenced, with tenders finalized for numerous projects and a timeline set for completion of key infrastructure.

title: Farming meets the future: This AI-powered app equips farmers for a changing climate
desc: Farmers using Digital Green’s Farmer.Chat app receive valuable insights on pest and disease outbreaks, weather updates, and market access.

title: Around 80 pc of Maharashtra farmers will get free power by Dec next year: Devendra Fadnavis
desc: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced that approximately 80% of farmers in the state will receive free electricity by December 2026. This initiative aims to provide 12 hours of daytime electricity throughout the year, offering significant relief to the agricultural community. The government is actively working on generating 16000 MW of electricity under the Mukhyamantri Saur Krishi Yojana.

title: Farmers' meeting to be held on May 8 in Prayagraj on land acquisition issue: Rakesh Tikait
desc: Rakesh Tikait announced a farmers' meeting in Prayagraj on May 8 to address alleged land acquisition irregularities, highlighting it as a nationwide issue where land is purportedly being seized through conspiracies. He criticized the biased land measurement process favoring businessmen and lamented the deteriorating law and order in Uttar Pradesh, citing recent murders and promising to support the victims' families.

title: Duty amid despair: Unseen sacrifice of India's Agromet workers fighting climate chaos
desc: Despite the government's order to shut down 199 District Agrometeorological Units (DAMUs) in January 2024, around 130 employees continued their work unpaid, driven by their commitment to farmers. These employees secured a court stay and persevered, assisting farmers through challenging weather conditions. After a year of sacrifice, their salaries were finally released following court intervention on March 31.
